CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1941, pg. 3, reads: "Kay Club Celebrates Ten Years Of Progress - The Kay Boys' Club of Pittsburgh is one of the city's outstanding social agencies.  Hundreds of boys are shown the right road to travel under capable supervision at the club and later become model citizens.  The Kay Club is doing much to encourage good citizenship and patriotism.  Pictured above are some of the youngsters and officials who participate in programs sponsored by the Kay Boys' Club.  Left, graduates of Fifth and Schenley High schools recently held a graduation party at the Kay Club.  These youngsters are learning the value of social relationship under expert supervision.  Pictured here are, left to right: Marie Russell, Doris Corsey, Helen Davis, Beatrice Redd, Barbara Simpson, Hatie Everett, Miriam Lewis, and Odell Richardson.  Standing: Benjamin Foulk, Clarence Hutchinson, Alfreda Harper, Mildred Jane McKenzie, Betty Laverne White, Ruth Grant, Gladys Perry, Robert Kelley, Louis Cooper, John Brown, Ederick Todman, James Pruit, Lindsay S. Harper.  Next row, standing, Andrew Mapp, Richard Ward, Carl Morris, Edward Rouberts, Bradley Bluett, Richard Harris Williams.  Last row, Alonzo Gardner Jr., William Price Jr., Marcus Kelly, Willie Chambers and Jessee Everett....-Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, including from left: Marie Russell, Doris Corsey, Helen Davis, Beatrice Redd, Barbara Simpson, Hatie Everett, Miriam Lewis, and Odell Richardson; standing: Benjamin Foulk, Clarence Hutchinson, Alfreda Harper, Mildred Jane McKenzie, Betty Laverne White, Ruth Grant, Gladys Perry, Robert Kelley, Louis Cooper, John Brown, Ederick Todman, James Pruit, Lindsay S. Harper; next row standing: Andrew Mapp, Richard Ward, Carl Morris, Edward Rouberts, Bradley Bluett, Richard Harris Williams; last row: Alonzo Gardner Jr., William Price Jr., Marcus Kelly, Willie Chambers and Jessee Everett, gathered in Kay Boys Club, another version
